Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Haloganan (Hgn, HG1 L3Q,A19K, Synthetic AMPs, homodimer, Halocidin analog, UCSS2a, XXA)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid SUBSTITUTION, animal-derived, natural derivatives

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is 89.47% similar toHG1L: 21%, K: 16%, A=G=N=H: 11%. Warning: chain B sequence is the same as chain A.Chemical modification: there is an intermolecular S-S bond between the two chains.Activity: active against S. aureus MRSA (MIC 4 ug/ml),  B. subtilis KCTC 2213 (MIC 1 ug/ml), M. luteus KCTC 9341 (MIC 2 ug/ml), vancomycin-resistant E. faecium strain CCARM 5028 anti-VRE (MIC 4 ug/ml), multidrug-resistant L. monocytogenes CCARM 2161 (MIC 4 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa CCARM 2161 MDRPA (MIC 4 ug/ml), E. coli KCTC 1039 (MIC 4 ug/ml), K. oxytoca KCTC 1686 (MIC 4 ug/ml), C. freundii KCTC 2359 (MIC 4 ug/ml), S. enterica KCTC 2930 (MIC 4 ug/ml), 5 strains C. albicans (MIC 8-16 ug/ml). More to be added.
Literature Information.Author: Shin SH, Kim B, Park S, Jo S, Lee IH. 2014
Literature Information.Title: Haloganan: a novel antimicrobial peptide for treatmentof wound infections.
